intro: Microlicia pradosiana, commonly known as the Pradosian microlicia, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
